availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Kentucky, resident and soldier. Son of Burl Dunn and Elizabeth Dunn. Enrolled in the 34th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as private from July 27, 1863. Arrested on charge of robbery in Louisville, Kentucky, on August 20, 1863. Convicted of robbery in Jefferson County in October 1863. Imprisoned in the Kentucky State Penitentiary in Frankfort in October 1863. Pardoned by Thomas E. Bramlette in order to return to service in the 34th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry on April 19, 1864. Confined in Louisville on charge of desertion in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 320.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0407.
KYR-0001-004-0769.
